document.heading: Corporate and Unincorporated Business Franchise Surtax Act of 1976

history.narrative: Law 1-77, the “Corporate and Unincorporated Business Franchise Surtax Act of 1976,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-265, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 6, 1976 and April 20, 1976, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 18, 1976, it was assigned Act No. 1-120 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
